snippet: The State Department will wait to decide whether to allow construction of the pipeline until it has a clearer idea how legal challenges to the route through Nebraska will be settled, sources said.
abstract: State Department will delay its decision on construction of 1,700-mile Keystone XL pipeline until it has a clearer idea of how legal challenges to the pipeline’s route through Nebraska will be settled; both supporters and opponents of the pipeline criticize the delay as a political ploy aimed at punting the final call on the divisive project until after midterm elections in November.
lead_paragraph: The State Department will wait to decide whether to allow construction of the pipeline until it has a clearer idea how legal challenges to the route through Nebraska will be settled, sources said.

headline.main: U.S. Delays Final Call on Keystone XL Pipeline
headline.print_headline: U.S. Delays Final Call on Pipeline
